se.jguru.nazgul.core.algorithms.launcher.api

Class AbstractApplicationLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jguru.nazgul.core.algorithms.launcher.api.AbstractApplicationLauncher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ApplicationLauncher, StandardLifecycle

    public abstract class AbstractApplicationLauncher
extends Object
implements StandardLifecycle
    Abstract StandardLifecycle implementation, handling command-line arguments, exception printouts and help screens.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractApplicationLauncher

        protected AbstractApplicationLauncher(String briefApplicationDescription,
                                      String[] commandLineArguments,
                                      String appVersion)
        Compound constructor, creating an AbstractApplication instance from the given arguments.
        Parameters:
        briefApplicationDescription - A brief, human-readable description of the application. Example: Performs load tests on the CGW-internal radius server.
        commandLineArguments - The command-line arguments supplied to a main method call.
        appVersion - A version descriptor for this application.

        commandLineArguments - The command-line arguments supplied to a main method call.
        appVersion - A version descriptor for this application.
        patternsForVerboseLogging - A List holding java regexp patterns, defining which

      • getJarFile

        protected final File getJarFile()

      • addOptions

        protected void addOptions(org.apache.commons.cli.Options options)
        Overload this method to add any Command-line Options to be supported by this AbstractApplication.
        Parameters:
        options - The command-line options to be used by this AbstractApplication instance.

      • execute

        public final void execute()
        Main entrypoint to the application, which executes its lifecycle by invoking the following methods (in order): 
           try {
      // First, validate the given CLI arguments.
      validateArguments(commandLine);

      // Second, fire the actual application.
      runApplication(commandLine);
   } catch (RuntimeException e) {

      // Whoops.
      printUsage(e.getMessage());
   }
        Specified by:
        execute in interface ApplicationLauncher
        Specified by:
        execute in interface StandardLifecycle

      • isArgumentSupplied

        protected final boolean isArgumentSupplied(String argument)
        Checks if the provided key is given as an argument on the command line or not.
        Parameters:
        argument - The argument which should be validated.
        Returns:
        true if the provided argument was supplied on the command line launching this application.

      • getValue

        protected final String getValue(String argument,
                                String fallbackValue)
        Acquires the value of a command-line argument, or fallbackValue should the argument not have been supplied.
        Parameters:
        argument - the argument whose value should be retrieved.
        fallbackValue - a value returned if the given argument had no value or was not supplied on the command line launching this application.
        Returns:
        the value of a command-line argument, or fallbackValue should the argument not have been supplied.

      • getBriefApplicationDescription

        public final String getBriefApplicationDescription()
        Retrieves the application description of this AbstractApplicationLauncher instance.
        Returns:
        the application description of this AbstractApplicationLauncher instance.

      • printUsage

        public void printUsage(String errorMessage)
        Prints a human-readable usage message for the application, given a status message which can be acquired from an exception or passed by a user given launch requirements (i.e. the user wanting the usage help printed).
        Specified by:
        printUsage in interface ApplicationLauncher
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The message from an Exception, or status information such as "Help Printed.".
